* Brand: IBM/Lenovo
* Make : T43
* Model: 2668-71G
* Website: <nowiki>[[http://www-307.ibm.com/pc/support/site.wss/quickPath.do?quickPathEntry=266871g&sitestyle=lenovo|Lenovo Support Page]]</nowiki> 

=== Hardware Summary ===

** 2.0 Ghz Centrino <<BR>>
** ATI M22 PCIe (Radeon Mobility M300 aka x300) with 64MB (native @ 1400x1050 on 14.1") <<BR>>
** DVD/CDRW Combo (also available with DVD Writer) <<BR>>
** SATA 80 GB <<BR>>
** Broadcom Gigabit Ethernet
** Broadcom Bluetooth Adapter
** Intel PRO/Wireless 2915ABG MiniPCI Adapter

Will be testing Edgy soon

==== Notes ====

One of the better supported laptop platforms under Linux. You will find that almost everything works "out of the box".

Following thermal sensors work:
** CPU Temp
** Fan Speed
** Battery Temp
** HDD Temp
** Video Temp

If you have previously setup fingerprint scanning on Windows integrated with the BIOS, this will continue to work even with Linux installed.  There are ways to integrate the fingerprint scanner with linux so that you can login via your fingerprint. Details on this, and other unsupported hardware/features are at the <nowiki>[[http://www.thinkwiki.org|ThinkWiki]]</nowiki>.

In order to get suspend/restore working without artifacts on the screen or an unusable screen, use the binary drivers from ati.com.
